Ensure that the shapes, sketches, loops, and faces are accurately defined, and avoid using specific boolean operation terms.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The first line (line\\_1) begins at the origin (0.0, 0.0) and ends at (0.723, 0.0) and sets the base width. The second line (line\\_2) starts at (0.723, 0.0) and ends at (0.723, 0.75) and sets the height. The third line (line\\_3) starts at (0.723, 0.75) and ends at (0.0, 0.75) and completes the top side of the rectangle. The fourth line (line\\_4) starts at (0.0, 0.75) and connects back to the origin (0.0, 0.0) and completes the bottom side of the rectangle. Face 1: | Curve | Start Point | End Point | |||| | Line 1| (0.0, 0.0) | (0.723, 0.0) | | Line 2| (0.723, 0.0) | (0.723, 0.75) | | Line 3| (0.723, 0.75) | (0.0, 0.75) | | Line 4| (0.0, 0.75) | (0.0, 0.0) | 2. **Transform the 2D sketch to 3D Sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch by applying the coordinate system's euler angles (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.7229, 0.0). This will rotate and position the sketch in the proper orientation as described in the coordinate system. 3. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model** Extrude the 2D sketch along the positive Z-axis by the value of 0.7229 given in the "extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal" field. This will create the three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, as specified by the "description" JSON object. The final dimensions of the part as encompassed by the rectangular prism are 0.75, 0.7229, and 0.75 in the X, Y, and Z dimensions, respectively, as provided in the "description" JSON object. **Note**: Use the descriptions provided without making any assumptions. For more information about the CAD Assembly JSON structure, continue with parts 2 and beyond, which can be constructed similarly to the approach shown here.</description>
